doc.field: New-York Historical Society collection of World War II posters
New-York Historical Society collection of World War II posters

Posters from companies noting their excellence in providing products to the military. The bulk of the posters are from the Auto-Ordnance Corporation, the manufacturer of the Thompson submachine gun, or Tommy gun. Two other companies are represented: Nabisco/National Biscuit Company and Burroughs Wellcome & Co. See also the Bella C. Landauer Collection of Business and Advertising Ephemera (PR 31, series VIII) for extensive examples of E awards.
New-York Historical Society collection of World War II posters
